result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrell T Hitchcock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:19 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to counts 1-4 and counts 5-7 will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty and as a repeater.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1-4 as charged and orders counts 5-7 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

COUNT 1 - 18 months of Initial Confinement and 2 years of Extended Supervision, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 5 years.

COUNTS 2-4 (EACH COUNT) - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 5 years.

CONDITIONS:

-Court finds the defendant indigent and waives the payment of the court costs on each count.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Pay all arrearage and keep up with current child support order

Court finds the defendant not eligible for CIP and SAR programs.

Court adjourned at 11:29 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-17-2015 11:00 am

3:07 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Babr Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has an agreement but requests another count date.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on November 17, 2015 at 11:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 3:07 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-13-2015 02:00 pm

10:55 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - need to set appointment to meet to discuss the offer.  Court goes over document from the Child Support agency.  Statement by ADA, has received a copy.  Statement by Atty Privat - does not represent on the child supoort case.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on October 13, 2015 at 2:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 10:57 a.m.

10:27 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant is running late and requests a new court date.  Court re-sets to 10:45 a.m. today.

Court adjourned at 10:28 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-01-2015 10:00 am

2:35 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - needs to meet with the defendant and requests another hearing.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on September 1, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:36 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 07-21-2015 02:00 pm

3:05 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Brab Privat .  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has an offer and time to talk with defendant.  Court will set for plea & sentencing on July 21, 2015 at 2:00p.m.

Court adjourned at 3:06 p.m.

4:08 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court will set for status hearing on June 15, 2015 at 3:00 p.m.

2:18 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $1,000.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing on April 6, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.
